org.orgName: United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.| No. 3038 CERTIFICATE OF PROBABLE CAUSE.

An order having been entered herein on September 30, 1915, allowing an appeal in the above entitled cause to the Supreme Court of the United States and no ceritificate of probable cause having been issues at said time, and counsel for the respective parties having stipulated that said certificate may now be issued and transmitted to the Supreme Court of the United States, and the Court having considered said matter,

NOW, THEREFORE, I, Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the above entitled Court, before whom said cause was tried and by whom a decision therein was rendered on September 23, 1915, do hereby certify in accordance with the Act of Congress of March 10, 1908, (35 Stat. L 40) that there is probable cause for the allowance of said appeal.
DONE in open Court this 4th day of September, 1917, as of September 30, 1915, nunc pro tunc.
Jeremiah Neterer District Judge and the presiding Judge before whom said cause was heard.
LAW OFFICES CASSIUS E. GATES L. C. SMITH BUILDING, SEATTLE
